page.title: 09Churches in Kennoway
page.content: There are five churches in Kennoway, four of which are still in use. The Free Church of Scotland had to close its doors earlier this year because of vandalism. Kennoway Parish Church was originally sited in the Causeway next to the Mercat Cross but is now in Cupar Road. The church was founded in 1619 and has the second oldest communion cup in Scotland dating back to 1671. The Arnott Gospel Hall, also in Cupar Road, was originally a second Church of Scotland church serving the people to the north of the village but changed to a Gospel Hall in 1977. The Elim Pentecostal Church is in New Road at present but plans to move to the disused Free Church premises, also in New Road. St.Giles Church, Langside Crescent, serves the Roman Catholic community.
